intro: Tarenna acutisepala, commonly known as the acute-lobed tarenna, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Asia. It is a shrub or small tree characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves with acute or obtuse tips. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
